Content: Fourteen newly appointed Ambassadors and High Commissioners presented their credentials to President Maithripala Sirisena. The handing over of credentials of the new foreign diplomats took place the Presidentâ€™s House. The new High Commissioner of the Eswatini State Mlondi Solomon Dlamini presented his credentials to the President. Francois Delhaye is the new Ambassador of Belgium. Makarimi Abissola Adchoubou is the new Ambassador of Benin. Carlos Jose de Pinho e Melo Pereira Marques handed over his credentials as the new Ambassador of the Portuguese Republic. Muhammed Cenqic handed over his credentials as the Ambassador of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Fatoumata Balde has been appointed as the Ambassador of the Guinea Republic. The new High Commissioner of the Namibian Republic is Gabriel Pandureni Sinimbo. The new Ambassador of the Hellenic Republic is Dionssios Kyvetos. Juan Rolondo Angulo handed over his credentials as the new Ambassador of the Chile Republic. Ambassador of the Bulgarian Republic Eleonara Dimitrova Dimitrova handed over her credentials to the President. Brenden Ward presented his credentials representing Ireland. Coromoto Godoy Calderon presented her credentials as the Bolivarian Republic Ambassador of Venezuela. The new Ambassador of Ethiopian Federal Democratic Republic is Tizita Mulugeta. Among these foreign diplomats High Commissioner of the Esvatini Kingdom will discharge his duties from Kuala Lumpur, the Ambassador of the Benin Republic from Tokyo while all other diplomats will be serving from New Delhi.
